intro: Aiouea haussknechtii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glossy surface. Aiouea haussknechtii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats.
